title: So did Riot just completely forget about the Harrowing?
body:
Is worlds really a reason, to just COMPLETELY forget about the Harrowing, release some crappy skins that honestly seemed like they were just slapped together so they had something.

At least TRY Riot, only 25% of your audience even PAYS attention to the LCS, thats not a reason to completely forget about the rest of us.

That was the harrowing, the lore.
And it was great.
Some of us never read the lore of champions and we're playing for like ..4 years, not really interested in reading lore for harrowing. It's a moba game not a book club if you ask me.
If you ask me LCS is really boring to watch

>
> Some of us never read the lore of champions and we're playing for like ..4 years, not really interested in reading lore for harrowing. It's a moba game not a book club if you ask me.

I agree, they spend so much time on that stupid lore, i never read it, and im sure there are plenty of people who havent either.

However... 

You didn't go out of your way to basically petition Riot's boards and hold a part of their team to a furnace and tell them to start working and fix their mistakes or you'll throw them in, either. They're still not out of the fire yet. They can still feel its warmth while they try to work away from it and fix the problems that the huge lore retcon caused. 

The separation of Harrowing from Halloween just when Worlds happens to be taking place on Halloween looks extremely suspect on the part of Riot. There's already one team held toward the fire. We don't need more. The people to whom lore matters is what that lore is for. That's why they have a team dedicated specifically to the lore so it doesn't impact the development from any other team.

Also, you may have never read the lore, but unlike Robert RGN up there, you went ahead and insulted it for no reason instead of just saying you aren't interested. That's pretty rude, man.

I feel like he did more of sharing his opinion
than insutling annyone or annything
The "stupid lore" comment is incredibly insulting, considering that it was very well written on the lore team's part.
Then why are people complaining in the lore section of the boards if they don't give a shit about it?
Because there is no "General" section of the chat and no place on the current board is fitting for such a thread except for General
...then why not post it in general?

Back when I started playing, my internet was a huge mess, couldn't play at certain times, so it gave me something to do connected to League while not mucking up 10 people's gaming experience.  Also, am a huge fan of decent lore.  Doesn't have to be amazing, just something to tie it all together.

There are games I really, REALLY want to play but can't due to ping and lags. Result? I'm not playing them because not only my experience would be bad, but also the experience of those I interact with. So I know pretty damn well how it's like not to be able to play a game with it's servers based on another continent or how it is to have a bad internet but nobody cared about that nor they should. Age of Wulin is something of the top of my head for example. Don't play games you can't really play. Especially not competitive games like mobas who depend on all team members having a good connection to play in the first place.
Which is why I started to dive into the lore during those times of days when I couldn't play, it gave me something to do connected with the game that wasn't buggering up the game for 10 people.
Yet another thing Riot has failed to deliver on.
Top notch, Mr. Bangles
They should slap a seasonal skin on dragon and baron. Like a skeleton version of each of them

19,203 RP for the complete bundles and this year's new skins AND icons if I was a new player and I wanted all the skins I could ask for because I have A LOT of cash to spend.

Apparently RIOT decided it was not going to be a worthwhile business endeavor.
So can I have some of your not-used cash, or...?
I know the LCS is popular and all but that kind of stuff just seems ridiculous to me.  Who watches a video game as a sport?  AND NOW IT STOLE MY HARROWING SKINS
A lot of people.

Riot doesn't get half of the profit they would've from Worlds. it would be irresponsible to focus on the harrowing more than worlds, or even at the same level. 

They would never choose players over money. o well.

If I recall, even in 2014 it was stated that Riot doesn't really profit off of the tournaments they host. So, yeah, Harrowing would've generated far, far more profit for Riot than the Worlds tournament. And since they let it slip past the prime consumer marketing time for these kinds of skins, they dropped the ball pretty hard.
